Introducing our Conscious Cashmere collection. An edit of four sweaters, all lovingly designed and made with the environment in mind. Here’s what makes these styles so special…

settings.grid-content: An eco-friendly ethos has underpinned our collections since we first founded Chinti & Parker. Today, we are even more passionate about discovering new and innovative ways to lessen our impact on the environment. Our Conscious Cashmere collection aims to raise awareness of the importance of choosing well-made clothing that will last, in favour of fast, throw-away fashion. With zero compromise on aesthetics or quality, these colourful, fun, and eco-friendly sweaters are as luxurious as ever.

The collection features four statement sweaters, each made using 97% recycled cashmere. The other 3% is wool that allows the yarn to be spun effectively. On average, recycled cashmere uses 98% less water, 80% less electricity, 50% less chemicals, and creates 90% less CO2 emissions compared with non-recycled yarns.  

The entire collection is crafted in London, in a factory not far from our headquarters. This maintains a lower carbon footprint and supports garment production here in the UK. Another thoughtful – and zero-waste – consideration: the swing tags on each garment are made using seeded paper that, once planted, will grow into wildflowers.  

As with everything we produce, we hope that these sweaters are worn and cherished for a long time to come. Our mantra? Waste made wonderful.

In a bid to further offset carbon emissions, we’re working withTreeapp to plant a tree for every single sweater sold from our Conscious Cashmere collection. Treeapp is working hard to tackle the problem of deforestation and restore vital ecosystems as quickly as possible. To date, they have planted almost 2million trees worldwide – from mangroves on the island of Lombok to fruit trees in Brazil. You can find out more at thetreeapp.org

To mark the launch of this collection, and to give back, we will be donating 100% of the profits from sales of the oatmeal ‘Love’ sweater to Save the Children’s Pakistan Flood Crisis. This is the worst flooding to have hit Pakistan in decades. More than a million homes have been destroyed or badly damaged, leaving many homeless and exposed to the elements. Donations will help to provide much needed blankets, food, and hygiene packs to the 16million children affected by this natural disaster.

settings.title: Sustainability and Compare Ethics
settings.text: We started working with Compare Ethics, a business which verifies and communicates product impact claims, in August 2022. We think transparency is key and it is important to be audited independently. Compare Ethics enables shoppers to shop with confidence, knowing that the claims made are fact. They call out false claims and celebrate responsible brands by verifying products and attributing scalable ratings.

settings.title: Yarn Sourcing and the SFA
settings.text: We are a member of the Sustainable Fibre Alliance (SFA), a global multi-stake holder initiative with a mission to ensure the long term viability of the cashmere sector. We prioritise the use of responsibly sourced, natural yarns, such as cashmere, wool, and cotton in our collections.To find out more about where our cashmere comes from, click here.
